name: By The Throat - One Good Night 7"
description:
WSR 105 - 7

258 on Green and Black Swirl Vinyl. Digital Download included. 

You like your punk music fast, a bit of anger, and a bunch of melody? Well check out this 7″ by local band By The Throat. This 7″ is chock full of raging rock and roll that will have you begging for more. 5 songs that hearkens back to a time when Boston was known for being dangerous, but it still retains a lot of the melody that it later became known for. Sick riffage throughout!

FFO The Freeze, Gang Green, DYS (but none of that fire and ice crap)


Track Listing

 1. Break Away
 2. Ask Yourself Why
 3. Disagree To Agree
 4. Western Front
 5. Nowhere To Hide

name: 007Hundred Club/Drago split CD
description:
WSR 104 - 2

Drago returns with their second release on Winter Street Records this time bringing friends 007 Hundred Club for their debut EP. The Drago vs. 007 Hundred Club split pits former Darkbuster members Mike "Sweet Pea" Gurley and Eric "Rice" Edmonston against former Darkbuster band mates Paul Delano and Danny "DitH" O'Halloran in a full out brawl of a musical steel cage match. As a whole this split takes the listener back to a time when Boston ruled the punk rock and hardcore world. This split could have easily been added to the famous "This is Boston, Not LA" compilation and fit in seamlessly. If you are looking for in your face punk rock and hardcore this split is for you.

Track Listing

 1. 007 Hundred Club - Toxic City 
 2. 007 Hundred Club - Electro
 3. 007 Hundred Club - Lead Up
 4. 007 Hundred Club - Condition Red
 5. 007 Hundred Club - Pickles
 6. Drago - This Is Hardcore
 7. Drago - Vegan
 8. Drago - Ian Mackaye Is A Douche
 9. Drago - What's The Answer
10.Drago - Drink Beer And Mosh

name: Up For Nothing - We're Singing Our Last Breath CD
description:
WSR 103 - 2

Brooklyn's own Up For Nothing are back following up their debut EP with their first full length on Winter Street Records. We're Singing Our Last Breath is 13 songs of speed, aggression, melody and vocal harmonies. We're Singing Our Last Breath will have you pumping your fist, hopping on stage and grabbing the mic to sing along. Punk rock where you can understand the lyrics and the melody grabs you, "Zero To Sixty" and "The Last Rope" are so catchy you can't help but hit repeat on your iPod. New York Hardcore veteran Ernie Parada(Token Entry, Grey Area) sings his last breath on the title track. Up For Nothing proves punk rock can be melodic and fun without being emo or the next fad on the Hot Topic shelves. Raw power, pure emotion, Up for Nothing.

Track Listing

1. We're Singing Our Last Breath
2. It's Time To Breath
3. Until Then
4. Hell's Bottomless Pits
5. The Last Rope
6. The End Is Strong
7. Rob The Minister
8. Ufn=fun
9. I Never Liked You
10. Close Your Eyes And Drive
11. The Wrong Direction
12. Zero To Sixty
13. The New Years Eve

name: Drago - Bowling With Stalin
description:
WSR 102 - 2

Boston's Drago is back again with "Bowling with Stalin" the follow up to 2005's '90 Miles From Launch To Target'. 'Bowling With Stalin,' the bands first release on Winter Street Records is 19 tracks of true hardcore. Drago, much like on their debut album, truly wears their heart and influences on their collective sleeves. Staying true to the late 80's hardcore sound, in the vein of Judge, Sick Of It All, and Gorilla Biscuits that is intertwined with lyrical comedy that is reminiscent of Southern California Punks The Vandals the album Bowling with Stalin is a standout amongst hardcore records of 2007. Recorded At Fallen Angel Studios in May of 2007 "Bowling With Stalin" proves an improvement in production over 90 Miles while remaining true to the band's initial hardcore sound. If you're tired of metalcore and rapcore being passed off as hardcore, Drago's "Bowling With Stalin" will remind you that hardcore has not died.

Track Listing

1. 	High Value Target 
2. 	Cheif J. Strongbow
3. 	Structure Rtl
4. 	You Broke The Rules
5. 	My First, Your Face
6. 	Bodycast
